qas.question: When does the FBI work with the US Coast Guard and US Customs and Board Protection?
When does the FBI work with the National Transportation Safety Board?
What organization in the US government investigates the largest array of crimes?
What organization did General Ashcroft assign to lead organization in terrorism investigations?
What are the FBI and ICE-HSI both members of?
What agency usually works alone, without the help of other agencies?
What is an agency the CIA works in conjunction with?
What agency is responsible for investigating automobile crashes?
What agency investigates the smallest range of crimes?

plausible_answers.text: assigned the FBI as the designated lead organization in terrorism investigations

qas.question: What did General Ashcroft do before the September 11th attacks?

context: The <b5_0>FBI<b5_0/> often works in conjunction with other Federal agencies, including the <b6_0>U.S. Coast Guard<b6_0/> (USCG) and U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) in <a0_0>seaport and airport security<a0_0/>, and the <b7_0>National Transportation Safety Board<b7_0/> in <a1_0>investigating airplane crashes<a1_0/> and other critical incidents. Immigration and Customs Enforcement Homeland Security Investigations (<a2_0><b8_0>ICE-HSI<b8_0/><a2_0/>) has nearly the same amount of investigative man power as the FBI, and investigates the largest range of crimes. In the wake of the September 11 attacks, then-Attorney General Ashcroft <b9_0>assigned the <a3_0>FBI<a3_0/> as the designated lead organization in terrorism investigations<b9_0/> after the creation of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. ICE-HSI and the FBI are both integral members of the <a4_0>Joint Terrorism Task Force<a4_0/>.
